title: European car safety agency snubs BYD's Atto 3 driver assistance system
content: The model scored zero on driver monitoring features and performed poorly in preventing undertaking at speeds over 90 kilometres per hour (56 miles per hour), among other shortcomings, according to the Oct. 23 report from the European New Car Assessment Programme (Euro NCAP).

title: Mexico warns US ban on Chinese car tech could hurt automotive industry
content: Mexico's economy ministry said in a filing with the U.S. Commerce Department the proposal could have a "substantial impact on Mexico's automotive industry. Economically, it poses potential trade barriers, disruptions to supply chains, increased production costs, and a possible risk of reduced direct and indirect employment."

title: For new-age car buyers, connected features become a driving factor
content: Connected cars are becoming more popular among Indian consumers, with their market share in passenger vehicles doubling since 2021. Automakers are now incorporating these features across various models, offering advanced connectivity, safety, and convenience. This trend is fueled by rising consumer demand for high-end technology in vehicles.

title: ACMA Mobility Foundation partners with Fraunhofer for advanced R&D in auto component industry
content: The ACMA Mobility Foundation has signed an MOU with Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft for R&D collaboration in India's auto component industry. This partnership aims to enhance technology, sustainability, and innovation. It involves joint projects on sustainable production and road safety. The MoU will be in effect for three years, with possible extensions.

title: What would you prefer a car like, a laptop/mobile, or a DVD player
content: "Open cars" will be like "information technology systems on wheels," continuously receiving software updates that enhance both the driving experience and on-the-go functionality. This approach offers car owners greater freedom to upgrade their vehicle's features over time, much like how we upgrade our smartphones. On the other hand, "closed cars" resemble fixed systems, akin to DVD players with region controls, limiting flexibility and locking users into predefined settings.

title: Ola Electric launches digital twin platform to transform EV manufacturing

This innovation is already improving the efficiency at Ola's Futurefactory.

title: Hydrogen: The missing piece in India’s clean mobility revolution
content: In his address at the conference, Minister Hardeep Singh Puri emphasised the transformative potential of hydrogen for India’s energy landscape. “Green hydrogen requires local demand and local consumption... it will be successful in India. We still need to bring its cost of production down. The day refineries start using green hydrogen, we will be scaling it up,” said Minister Puri. His words echoed a central message from G-STIC: hydrogen is poised to become a vital component of India’s clean energy future, especially in sectors where EVs face limitations.

title: India to create roadmap after achieving 20% ethanol blending target, says Hardeep Singh Puri at G-STIC conference
content: Shri Hardeep Singh Puri highlighted India’s efforts in sustainable energy at the 7th G-STIC Delhi Conference. He talked about hydrogen fuel technology, ethanol blending, and green hydrogen. India's energy consumption is set to rise significantly by 2030. The government's proactive approach includes advancing ethanol blending targets and exploring green hydrogen as a viable energy source.

title: KPIT posts 44.7% YoY PAT growth for Q2 FY25, marking 17th consecutive growth quarter
content: KPIT achieved USD 173 million in revenues, showing constant currency (CC) growth of 20.1% YoY and dollar revenue growth of 19.3% YoY. This growth was primarily driven by the middleware and powertrain domains, with notable contributions from the Asian market and the passenger car vertical.

title: Michelin introduces AI challenge to innovate India's startup ecosystem with AI technologies
